marketNews.title: RI Inflation 1.57% YoY in 2024, Lowest in History
marketNews.content: BPS noted that Indonesia's Consumer Price Index (CPI) inflation eased to 1.57% in December 2024 (vs. November 2024: 1.55% YoY inflation), below the consensus expectation of 1.6% YoY and marking the lowest calendar year inflation since BPS first calculated inflation in 1958. This realization is within Bank Indonesia's lower target range of 1.5-3.5%. The low annual inflation in 2024 was driven by price decreases in several commodities, such as red chili, bird's eye chili, green chili, gasoline, air transport fares, and cellular phones. Meanwhile, core inflation in December 2024 reached 2.26% YoY (vs. November 2024: 2.26% YoY), lower than the consensus expectation of 2.28% YoY. On a monthly basis, Indonesia recorded inflation of 0.44% MoM (vs. November 2024: 0.30% MoM inflation), in line with expectations and marking the highest increase in the last 9 months. The monthly inflation increase was driven by the food, beverage, and tobacco group which experienced 1.33% MoM inflation, contributing 0.38 percentage point to inflation. Meanwhile, core inflation on a monthly basis was recorded at 0.17% MoM (vs. November 2024: 0.17% MoM inflation). On the same day as the inflation data release, S&P Global noted that Indonesia's manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) stood at 51.2 in December 2024 (vs. November 2024: 49.6), marking the first expansion of factory activity since June 2024 as output grew moderately. Spokesperson for the Ministry of Industry, Febri Hendri Antoni Arif, said that the policy of imposing a 12% VAT starting January 2025 caused industry players to increase their orders for stock, enabling Indonesia's manufacturing PMI in December 2024 to be in the expansive zone. Febri mentioned that industry players tried to seize the momentum before the VAT increase in 2025, although the government eventually revised the regulation to only target luxury goods.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: Although the low CPI inflation is mostly caused by the decrease in the prices of several commodities, the realization of core inflation itself is still classified as low - although it has started to increase/improve in recent months - which indicates that public purchasing power is still stagnant. Besides the fiscal aspect (cancellation of the 12% effective VAT tariff and stimulus packages), the impetus for economic growth and public purchasing power can come from the monetary side through an interest rate cut by Bank Indonesia. However, we assess that cutting the BI Rate requires a stronger and more stable rupiah exchange rate first.

marketNews.title: ✈️ GIAA Consolidation Targeted to be Completed in 6 Months
marketNews.content: State-Owned Enterprise Minister, Erick Thohir, said that the consolidation of Garuda Indonesia, PT Pelita Air Service, and PT Citilink Indonesia is targeted to be completed within the next 6 months. The discourse on the consolidation of these three airlines was previously conveyed by Erick in August 2023, aimed at reducing logistics costs. In September 2023, Erick mentioned that Pelita Air would be merged with Citilink - which is a subsidiary of GIAA - by the end of 2023 or early 2024, while GIAA would remain a standalone entity. In a separate occasion, GIAA Commercial Director, Ade R. Susardi, mentioned that GIAA is targeting an additional fleet of 20 new aircraft in 2025, composed of approximately 15-16 Boeing aircraft and the rest being Airbus. As of the end of September 2024, GIAA operated 61 aircraft units.

marketNews.title: MK Removes Presidential Threshold Provision
marketNews.content: The Constitutional Court (Mahkamah Konstitusi) on Thursday (2/1) abolished the provision on the presidential threshold or the candidacy ceiling for president and vice president as stipulated in Article 222 of Law No. 7/2017 concerning general elections. The Constitutional Court stated that the presidential threshold contradicts the political rights and sovereignty of the people, and violates morality, rationality, and injustice. Katadata reported that the implication of removing the presidential threshold is that all political parties registered to participate in the election can nominate presidential candidates, thus opening space for alternative presidential candidates whose emergence is not limited to a large coalition.

marketNews.title: Government Continues Copper Concentrate Export Ban
marketNews.content: Director at the Ministry of Trade, Andri Gilang Nugraha, said that the government continues the ban on copper concentrate exports as of January 1, 2025, regulated under Trade Ministerial Regulation No. 10/2024. Meanwhile, Director at the Ministry of ESDM, Julian Ambassadur Shiddiq, stated that there has been no directive regarding relaxation of copper concentrate exports for PT Freeport Indonesia, as extending the relaxation requires presidential permission. Previously, PT Freeport Indonesia had hoped to obtain relaxation for copper concentrate exports following the incident of its smelter burning down in JIIPE, Gresik, in October 2024.

marketNews.title: Indonesian Firms Get 1.5 Months Transition Period for B40 Biodiesel Mix Implementation
marketNews.content: Vice Minister of ESDM, Yuliot Tanjung, stated on Friday (3/1) that Indonesian companies will receive a 1.5-month transition period starting from January 1, 2025, to meet the B40 biodiesel requirement. Yuliot also mentioned that the government will soon release technical regulations regarding B40 implementation, although he did not specify when these regulations would be released. The B40 implementation itself was initially planned to take effect starting January 1, 2025, but fuel retailers and biodiesel producers could not draw up contracts for biodiesel distribution without technical regulations from the government. Meanwhile, Yuliot reiterated that the government plans to allocate 15.6 million kiloliters of biodiesel this year.

marketNews.title: Government to Increase Foreign Exchange Placement Portion and Tenure and Offer Higher Interest Rates
marketNews.content: Kontan reported that the government will increase the portion and tenor of foreign exchange placement from natural resource export proceeds (DHE SDA) from a minimum of 30% for 3 months to a minimum of 50% for 6-12 months. In return, the government will ask banks to provide higher interest rates up to 4.48% for these DHE SDA funds. Kontan also reported that revisions to DHE SDA related regulations will be released by the end of January 2025. Rumors regarding DHE SDA revisions were first reported by Reuters in November 2024, where this regulation revision is aimed at increasing foreign exchange reserves and ensuring the availability of domestic foreign exchange.

marketNews.title: Minister Rosan Roeslani: Apple Investment Confirmation in Indonesia to be Announced on January 7, 2025
marketNews.content: Minister of Investment and Downstreaming, Rosan Roeslani, said that confirmation regarding Apple Inc.'s (Nasdaq: AAPL) investment in Indonesia will be announced on January 7, 2025. Previously, Rosan stated that Apple was committed to investing 1 billion US dollars in Indonesia. This investment proposal was submitted after the Indonesian government banned the sale of the iPhone 16 series for not yet meeting the 40% domestic component level (TKDN).

marketNews.title: Ceramic Industry Changes 2025 Production Target After Utilization Rises at Year End
marketNews.content: Chairman of the Indonesian Ceramic Industry Association, Edy Suyanto, stated that the production utilization rate of the ceramic industry has risen from 67% in October 2024 to 75% in November-December 2024, following the implementation of anti-dumping import duties and mandatory implementation of Indonesian National Standards for ceramics. For 2025, Edy mentioned that ceramic companies in Indonesia have changed their average utilization target from 75% to 80%, taking into account the 3 million houses per year program and the latest VAT regulations.

marketNews.title: National Nutrition Agency: Free Nutritious Meal Program to be Released Next Week
marketNews.content: Head of the Legal and Public Relations Bureau of the National Nutrition Agency, Lalu Muhammad Iwan Mahardan, said that the free nutritious meal program will be released next Monday (6/1). In its initial stage, this program targets 3 million recipients consisting of children, pregnant women, and breastfeeding mothers.

marketNews.title: BEI to Release New Derivative Product: Foreign Index Futures Contract
marketNews.content: President Director of the IDX, Iman Rachman, stated that the IDX will launch a new derivative product named foreign index futures contract in mid-January 2025. In the initial stage, the IDX will release the MSCI Hong Kong Large Cap Index foreign index futures contract with the code MSLCHKMY, which will start trading no later than 1Q25. Going forward, Iman mentioned that the IDX will also launch Hang Seng and Nikkei foreign index futures contracts, although this still requires waiting for contracts with the licensor. Along with the increase in derivative products, the IDX hopes that more exchange members will be interested in becoming derivative members. As of now, only three exchange members have derivative licenses.

tickerNews.title: TCPI Plans Private Placement of Up to 500 Million New Shares
tickerNews.content: Transcoal Pacific plans to conduct a private placement of up to approximately 500 million new shares with an estimated execution price of 6,288 rupiah per share and a dilution effect of up to 9.1%. The prospective investors and the purpose of the funds have not yet been announced. This plan will be discussed at an Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders (EGMS) on January 6, 2025.

tickerNews.title: SIDO targets low single-digit revenue and net profit growth in 2025, plans new herbal products
tickerNews.content: President Director of Industri Jamu dan Farmasi Sido Muncul, David Hidayat, stated that his company targets low single-digit growth in revenue and net profit throughout 2025. To achieve this target, SIDO plans to release new herbal-based products, increase penetration in the domestic market, and expand export contribution. SIDO has budgeted capex of around 150-175 billion rupiah for 2025 (vs. 2024 allocation: 150-200 billion rupiah), intended for production facility maintenance and technology development. For 2024 performance, David is optimistic that SIDO will achieve the annual net profit target of more than +10% YoY.

tickerNews.title: ADHI targets new contract value of IDR 25-28 trillion for 2025, down from 2024 target
tickerNews.content: Corporate Secretary of Adhi Karya, Rozi Sparta, said that the company is targeting new contract value acquisition of approximately 25-28 trillion rupiah in 2025, lower by 25-33% from the 2024 target of 37.4 trillion rupiah. Meanwhile, President Director of ADHI, Entus Asnawi Mukhson, mentioned that ADHI recorded a new contract value of 20 trillion rupiah during 2024, down -46.5% YoY from the 2023 realization of 37.4 trillion rupiah and meeting only 53.5% of the 2024 target.

tickerNews.title: SKRN Divests Entire 70% Stake in Subsidiary PT Gunanusa Utama Fabricator for IDR 168 Billion
tickerNews.content: Superkrane Mitra Utama announced the divestment of its entire (70%) ownership in its subsidiary, PT Gunanusa Utama Fabricator, to its controlling shareholder, PT Saga Investama Sedaya. The total transaction value reached 168 billion rupiah and is intended to strengthen working capital to add lifting equipment (crane) fleet.

tickerNews.title: PT Southern Cross Textile Industries Increases Stake in TRIS to 9.99% via Share Purchase
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Trisula Textile Industries, PT Southern Cross Textile Industries, purchased 703 million TRIS shares at a price of 50 rupiah per share on December 27, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 35.2 billion rupiah. After this transaction, PT Southern Cross Textile Industries' ownership in TRIS increased from 0.3% to 9.99%.

tickerNews.title: Puri Sentul Permai Rebrands Swiss-Belhotel International Rest Area km 19 to Kedaton 8 Xpress
tickerNews.content: Puri Sentul Permai announced that it has taken over the operation of the Swiss-Belexpress Rest Area km 19 on the Cikampek toll road from Swiss-Belhotel International as of January 1, 2025. Following this takeover process, the hotel underwent a rebranding with a new name, Kedaton 8 Xpress.
